sen.j: 豊臣姓とは、天正時代に関白となって政権を掌握した豊臣秀吉に与えられた本姓である。
sen.e: The surname, Toyotomi, was a honsei (authentic surname of the clan which indicate its lineage) given to Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, who became Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor) in the Tensho era, gripping power over Japan.
sen.cmt: 本姓→定訳不明：honsei (authentic surname of the clan which indicate its lineage) としました。以下で本姓、姓、名字、名字が出てきますが、正しい定義が不明のため、正確な区別が必要と思われるところは、日本語音ローマ字表記と（英文仮訳）を併記しました。
sen.e: The surname, Toyotomi, was a honsei (original name of the clan which indicate its lineage) given to Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, who became Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor) and took control of the political power in the Tensho period.
sen.cmt: authentic surname→original name と修正しました。 clan を補いました。gripping power over Japan→took control of the political power と修正し、オーダーを修正しました。era→period と修正しました。
sen.e: The surname, Toyotomi, was a honsei (original name of the clan which indicate its lineage) given to Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, who became Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor) and took control of the political power in the Tensho period.

tit.e: Toyotomi as a sei (honsei or authentic surname)
tit.cmt: 姓→sei (honsei or authentic surname) としました。
tit.e: Toyotomi clan as a sei (honsei or original name)
tit.cmt: authentic surname→original name と修正しました。 clan を補いました。
tit.e: Toyotomi clan as a sei (honsei or original name)
The character of the Toyotomi clan
The character of the Toyotomi clan
The character of the Toyotomi clan

sen.j: 1585年（天正13年7月11日）、関白に任じられた羽柴秀吉は近衛前久の猶子となり藤原氏を名乗っていたが（関白相論）、前例のない他姓出身者の関白就任には多くの反発が予想された。
sen.e: Hideyoshi HASHIBA, who was appointed Kanpaku on August 6, 1585 (表記の変更), became an adopted child of Sakihisa KONOE, and used the name of the Fujiwara clan (kanpaku soron [disagreement over Kanpaku position]), however, backlash was anticipated against this unprecedented appointment, in which a person whose sei (surname) was not the inherited honsei (authentic surname) used by the traditional kanpaku families.
sen.cmt: 他姓出身者→定訳不明：a person whose sei (surname) was not the inherited honsei (authentic surname) used by the traditional kanpaku families としました。
sen.e: Hideyoshi HASHIBA, who was appointed Kanpaku on August 6, 1585, became an adopted child of Sakihisa KONOE, and used the name of the Fujiwara clan (kanpaku soron [disagreement over Kanpaku position]), however, many backlashes were anticipated against this unprecedented appointment, in which a person whose sei (surname) was not the inherited honsei (original name).
sen.cmt: (表記の変更) を削除しました。authentic surname→original name,backlash was→many backlashes were と修正しました。used by the traditional kanpaku families を削除しました。
sen.e: Hideyoshi HASHIBA, who was appointed Kanpaku on August 6, 1585, became an adopted child of Sakihisa KONOE, and used the name of the Fujiwara clan (kanpaku soron [disagreement over Kanpaku position]), however, many backlashes were anticipated against this unprecedented appointment, in which a person whose sei (surname) was not the inherited honsei (original name).

sen.j: そこで秀吉が多くの学識者から意見を聴取した結果、朝廷より源平藤橘（源氏・平氏・藤原氏・橘氏の総称）に匹敵する新姓を賜ることが公明正大であるという結論を得た。
sen.e: Then, after consulting many academic experts, Hideyoshi reached a conclusion that it would be justifiable to be granted a newly created honsei (authentic surname) by the Imperial Court, rivaling the four authentic surnames commonly called genpeitokitsu (shortened collective term of four major honseis : Genji [Minamoto clan], Heishi [Taira clan], Fujiwara clan, and Tachibana clan).
sen.cmt: 源平藤橘（源氏・平氏・藤原氏・橘氏の総称）→定訳不明：four authentic surnames commonly called genpeitokitsu (shortened collective term of four major honseis : Genji [Minamoto clan], Heishi [Taira clan], Fujiwara clan, and Tachibana clan) としました。
sen.e: Then, after consulting many academic experts, Hideyoshi reached a conclusion that it would be justifiable to be granted a newly created honsei (original name) by the Imperial Court, matching the genpeitokitsu (general term of four major honseis : the Minamoto clan, the Taira clan, the Fujiwara clan, and the Tachibana clan).
sen.cmt: authentic surname→original name, と修正しました。 「源平藤橘（源氏・平氏・藤原氏・橘氏の総称）に匹敵する」の部分を修正しました。
sen.e: Then, after consulting many academic experts, Hideyoshi reached a conclusion that it would be justifiable to be granted a newly created honsei (original name) by the Imperial Court, matching the genpeitokitsu (general term of four major honseis : the Minamoto clan, the Taira clan, the Fujiwara clan, and the Tachibana clan).

sen.j: その結果、佳姓を撰んで豊臣の新姓使用を朝廷に奏聞し、1586年（天正14年9月9日）に勅許を得た。
sen.e: As a result he, who chose 'Toyotomi' as an auspicious surname, reported to the Emperor on the use of it, and on October 21, 1586, he gained the Imperial permission.
sen.cmt: 佳姓→auspicious surname としました。
sen.e: As a result he, who chose 'Toyotomi' as an auspicious surname, reported to the Imperial Court on the use of it, and on October 21, 1586, he attained the imperial permission.
sen.cmt: Emperor→Imperial Court,Imperial→imperial,gained→attained と修正しました。
sen.e: As a result he, who chose 'Toyotomi' as an auspicious surname, reported to the Imperial Court on the use of it, and on October 21, 1586, he attained the imperial permission.

sen.j: これ以降、秀吉をはじめとする羽柴家の人物は自らの名乗りに専ら「豊臣」を使うようになり、いかなる名字も使用した形跡は無い。
sen.e: Since then, Hideyoshi and other members of the Hashiba family began to use solely 'Toyotomi' to present themselves, and a single use of any other myoji (family names) by them is not reported.
sen.cmt: 名字→myoji (family names) としました。
sen.e: After that, Hideyoshi and the other members of the Hashiba family began to use solely 'Toyotomi' to present themselves, and not a single use of any other myoji (family names) by them is traced.
sen.cmt: Since then→After that,reported→traced と修正しました。not の位置を修正しました。the を補いました。
sen.e: After that, Hideyoshi and the other members of the Hashiba family began to use solely 'Toyotomi' to present themselves, and not a single use of any other myoji (family names) by them is traced.

sen.j: この時代「豊臣」は本姓としても名字としても使われている。
sen.e: During this period, 'Toyotomi' was used as honsei (authentic surname) as well as myoji (family name).
sen.cmt: 本姓→honsei (authentic surname)、名字→myoji (family names) としました。
sen.e: During this period, 'Toyotomi' was used as honsei (original name) as well as myoji (family name).
sen.cmt: authentic surname→original name と修正しました。
sen.e: During this period, 'Toyotomi' was used as honsei (original name) as well as myoji (family name).

sen.j: 秀吉達の潜在的な名字が「羽柴」のままであったという見方は存在する。
sen.e: There is an observation that Hideyoshi and his family's implicit myoji had been always 'Hashiba.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。 潜在的な名字→implicit myoji としました。
sen.e: There is an observation that Hideyoshi and his family's latent myoji had been always 'Hashiba.'
There is an observation that Hideyoshi and his family's latent myoji had been always 'Hashiba.'

sen.j: が、当時の紀伊国造家や津守氏のように本姓はあっても名字の存在しない家や、源義高 (左兵衛権佐)流源氏のように姓と名字が同一の例も存在するなど、名字と本姓が必ず別であるという規則は無いこともあり、豊臣宗家の名字を断定することは出来ない。
sen.e: However, there was no strict rule that myoji (family name) and honsei (authentic surname) had to be different as the following examples show: in the cases of the then the Miyatsuko family of Kii Province, and the Tsumori family, the honsei (authentic surname) existed but they had no myoji (family name), on the other hand, in the case of the Genji family of the line of MINAMOTO no Yoshitaka (Sahyoe no gon no suke (provisional assistant captain of the Left Division of Middle Palace Guards), the sei (authentic surname) and myoji (family name) were the same, and therefore, it can not be said with certainty what was the myoji of head family of TOYOTOMI.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, there was no strict rule on that myoji (family name) and honsei (original name) had to be different as these examples show: in the cases of the Miyatsuko family of Kii Province, and the Tsumori family, the honsei (original name) existed but they had no myoji (family name), on the other hand, the Minamoto clan, the line of MINAMOTO no Yoshitaka (Sahyoe no gon no suke [provisional assistant captain of the Left Division of Middle Palace Guards]), the sei (surname) and myoji (family name) were the same, and therefore, it is impossible to conclude what was the myoji of the head family of TOYOTOMI.
sen.cmt: on, the を補いました。authentic surname→original name,the following→these と修正しました。the then, in the case of を削除しました。Genji family→Minamoto clan,カッコを修正しました。authentic surname→surname,it can not be said with certainty →it is impossible to conclude と修正しました。
sen.e: However, there was no strict rule on that myoji (family name) and honsei (original name) had to be different as these examples show: in the cases of the Miyatsuko family of Kii Province, and the Tsumori family, the honsei (original name) existed but they had no myoji (family name), on the other hand, the Minamoto clan, the line of MINAMOTO no Yoshitaka (Sahyoe no gon no suke [provisional assistant captain of the Left Division of Middle Palace Guards]), the sei (surname) and myoji (family name) were the same, and therefore, it is impossible to conclude what was the myoji of the head family of TOYOTOMI.

sen.j: 「豊臣氏」は本姓であって、「織田氏」（本姓は平朝臣）や「徳川氏」（本姓は源朝臣）などといった名字とは性質が異なる。
sen.e: Toyotomi' was its honsei (authentic surname) and it is different in character from the myoji (family name) in such cases as 'Oda clan' (honsei was Taira no Ason) and 'Tokugawa clan' (honsei was Minamoto no Ason).

Toyotomi' was its honsei (original name) and it is different in character from the myoji (family name) in such cases as the 'Oda clan' (honsei was Taira no Ason) and the 'Tokugawa clan' (honsei was Minamoto no Ason).
sen.cmt: authentic surname→original name と修正しました。the を補いました。
sen.e: Toyotomi' was its honsei (original name) and it is different in character from the myoji (family name) in such cases as the 'Oda clan' (honsei was Taira no Ason) and the 'Tokugawa clan' (honsei was Minamoto no Ason).

sen.j: 本姓による名乗りでは、姓と諱の間に氏への所属を意味する「の」を入れるのが原則的な読み方である。
sen.e: When one presented himself by sei (or honsei, authentic surname), the full name should be pronounced by inserting 'no,' in between his sei (authentic surname) and his imina (personal name) to indicate his belonging.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。 姓→sei (or honsei, authentic surname) としました。
sen.e: When one presented himself or herself by sei (or honsei, original name), the full name should be read by inserting 'no,' in between his or her sei (authentic surname) and imina (personal name), to indicate his belonging.
sen.cmt: or herself を補いました。authentic surname→original name,pronounced→read,or her を補い、his を削除しました。
sen.e: When one presented himself or herself by sei (or honsei, original name), the full name should be read by inserting 'no,' in between his or her sei (authentic surname) and imina (personal name), to indicate his belonging.

sen.j: この原則に従うと「豊臣秀吉」は「とよとみ・の・ひでよし」と読むことになるが、この原則が当てはまらない事例も相当数ある。
sen.e: According to this rule, 'Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI' should read 'TOYOTOMI no Hideyoshi,' although there are numerous exceptions that does not follow this principle.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: According to this rule, 'Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI' should be read 'TOYOTOMI no Hideyoshi,' although there are numerous exceptions that does not follow this principle.
According to this rule, 'Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI' should be read 'TOYOTOMI no Hideyoshi,' although there are numerous exceptions that does not follow this principle.

sen.j: 豊臣氏の人物の名前は「とよとみ・○○○○」と言った具合に「の」抜きで呼ばれることが一般的である。
sen.e: The family members of the Toyotomi clan usually were called without placing 'no,' like 'xxxx (personal name) TOYOTOMI.'
sen.cmt: 「とよとみ・○○○○」→'xxxx (personal name) TOYOTOMI' としました。
sen.e: The family members of the Toyotomi clan usually were called without placing 'no,' such as 'xxxx (personal name) TOYOTOMI.'
sen.cmt: like→such as と修正しました。
sen.e: The family members of the Toyotomi clan usually were called without placing 'no,' such as 'xxxx (personal name) TOYOTOMI.'

sen.j: 『豊臣』の由来ははっきりしておらず、「聖徳太子の名前「豊聡耳（とよとみみ）」から取られたという説などがあるものの、現在のところ定まった見解は無い。
sen.e: The origin of the surname "Toyotomi" is not clear, and there is no established opinion on it, although there are some theories including a theory that it derived from 'the name of Prince Shotoku, 'Toyotomimi.'
The origin of the "Toyotomi" is not clear, and there is no established opinion on it, although there are some theories including that, it derived from the name of Prince Shotoku, 'Toyotomimi.'
sen.cmt: surname, a theory を削除しました。カンマを補い、クォートを修正しました。
sen.e: The origin of the "Toyotomi" is not clear, and there is no established opinion on it, although there are some theories including that, it derived from the name of Prince Shotoku, 'Toyotomimi.'

tit.j: 擬制的な一族としての豊臣氏
tit.cmt: 擬制的な一族→定訳不明：pseudo-family としました。

sen.j: 凡下平民の出自でこれといった一門衆家臣団を持たない秀吉は、有力家臣である大名や武家に任官の際に豊臣姓や羽柴の名字を与え、自らは豊臣氏の氏長者となることで統治しようとした。
sen.e: Hideyoshi, who was from a family of ordinary commoner and had no hereditary vassals of the family, tried to strengthen his dominance as the head of the uji no choja (the head) of the Toyotomi clan, by granting his sei (authentic surname) 'Toyotomi' and his myoji (family name) 'Hashiba' to daimyos (feudal lords) and samurai families, who were forming his powerful vassals, when he appointed them a certain government post.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。文中の「「羽柴（官職）豊臣朝臣某」(例・徳川家康)もしくは名字は与えず「某（官職）豊臣某」（例・片桐且元）と名乗らせて自らの一族とみなし、」を下列に移動しました。
sen.e: Hideyoshi, who was from a family of ordinary commoner and had no hereditary vassals of the family, tried to strengthen his reign as the head of the uji no choja (the head) of the Toyotomi clan, by granting the name of the 'Toyotomi' or his myoji (family name) 'Hashiba' to those influential daimyo (feudal lords) and samurai families, when he appointed them to a certain government post.
sen.cmt: dominance→reign,his sei (authentic surname)→the name of the,and →or, daimyos→those daimyo と修正しました。influential, to を補い、who were forming his powerful vassals を削除しました。
sen.e: Hideyoshi, who was from a family of ordinary commoner and had no hereditary vassals of the family, tried to strengthen his reign as the head of the uji no choja (the head) of the Toyotomi clan, by granting the name of the 'Toyotomi' or his myoji (family name) 'Hashiba' to those influential daimyo (feudal lords) and samurai families, when he appointed them to a certain government post.

sen.j: 例えば、「羽柴（官職）豊臣朝臣某」(例・徳川家康)もしくは名字は与えず「某（官職）豊臣某」（例・片桐且元）と名乗らせて自らの一族とみなした。
sen.e: For example in some cases (ex. Ieyasu TOKUGAWA), he granted his sei and myoji and made them call themselves like 'Hashiba, (government post), TOYOTOMI no Ason, personal name,' while in other cases (ex. Katsumoto KATAGIRI), he did not grant his myoji and only made them call themselves like 'X, (government post), TOYOTOMI, personal name,' and regarded them as family members.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。「例えば、」文頭に加えました。 「羽柴（官職）豊臣朝臣某」→'Hashiba, (government post), TOYOTOMI no Ason, personal name' と表記しました。 「某（官職）豊臣某」→'X, (government post), TOYOTOMI, personal name' と表記しました。
sen.e: For example, as 'Hashiba, (government post), TOYOTOMI no Ason, personal name,' (ex. Ieyasu TOKUGAWA), he granted his sei and myoji, or, he did not grant his myoji, but made them call themselves as 'X, (government post), TOYOTOMI, personal name,' (ex. Katsumoto KATAGIRI), then he regarded them as his family members.
sen.cmt: 文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: For example, as 'Hashiba, (government post), TOYOTOMI no Ason, personal name,' (ex. Ieyasu TOKUGAWA), he granted his sei and myoji, or, he did not grant his myoji, but made them call themselves as 'X, (government post), TOYOTOMI, personal name,' (ex. Katsumoto KATAGIRI), then he regarded them as his family members.

sen.j: 徳川政権が松平氏の名字を限られた大名にしか許さなかったのに対し、豊臣姓を許された者は有力大名の家臣なども含まれるなど広範囲にわたっている。
sen.e: While the Tokugawa Shogunate administration only allowed a limited number of daimyos to use its myoji, 'Matsudaira,' those who were allowed to use Toyotomi's sei (authentic surname) can be found extensively, even among the retainers of powerful daimyos.

While the Tokugawa government only allowed a limited number of daimyo to use its myoji, the 'Matsudaira' clan, those who were allowed to use Toyotomi's sei (original name) were widened, including some retainers of powerful daimyo.
sen.cmt: Shogunate administration→government,daimyos→daimyo,authentic surname→original name the clan を補いました。文後半部分を文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: While the Tokugawa government only allowed a limited number of daimyo to use its myoji, the 'Matsudaira' clan, those who were allowed to use Toyotomi's sei (original name) were widened, including some retainers of powerful daimyo.

tit.e: Toyotomi clan in the Edo Period
Toyotomi clan in the Edo period
Toyotomi clan in the Edo period

sen.j: のちに徳川氏の覇権が確固たるものになっていく過程の中で、豊臣朝臣や羽柴氏を名乗ることを許されていた大名たちは、豊臣朝臣の本姓を捨てて「羽柴」を公称しないようになっていった。
sen.e: Afterwards, in the course of the Tokugawa clan's increased hegemony, those daimyos who were once allowed to use the denomination of TOYOTOMI no Ason and/or the Hashiba clan gradually abandoned this honsei (authentic surname) 'TOYOTOMI no Ason,' and stopped using the myoji 'Hashiba' in public.

Later, in the process of the hegemony of the Tokugawa clan becoming secured, those daimyos who were once allowed to use the denomination of TOYOTOMI no Ason and/or the Hashiba clan gradually abandoned this honsei (original name) 'TOYOTOMI no Ason,' and stopped using the myoji 'Hashiba' in public.
sen.cmt: 最初の部分をスムースに修正しました。authentic surname→original name と修正しました。
sen.e: Later, in the process of the hegemony of the Tokugawa clan becoming secured, those daimyos who were once allowed to use the denomination of TOYOTOMI no Ason and/or the Hashiba clan gradually abandoned this honsei (original name) 'TOYOTOMI no Ason,' and stopped using the myoji 'Hashiba' in public.

sen.j: 江戸時代を通じて豊臣朝臣を本姓とし続けた大名家は、秀吉の正室・高台院の実家である木下氏だけである。
sen.e: The Kinoshita clan was the family of Kodai-in, the lawful wife of Hideyoshi, and among the daimyo families, this was the only clan which maintained TOYOTOMI no Ason as its honsei (authentic surname) during all through the Edo Period.

The Kinoshita clan was the family home of Kodai-in, the lawful wife of Hideyoshi, and among the daimyo families, this was the only clan which maintained the TOYOTOMI no Ason as its honsei (original name) through the Edo period.
sen.cmt: family→her family home,the を補いました。authentic surname→original name,Period→period と修正しました。during through を削除しました。
sen.e: The Kinoshita clan was the family home of Kodai-in, the lawful wife of Hideyoshi, and among the daimyo families, this was the only clan which maintained the TOYOTOMI no Ason as its honsei (original name) through the Edo period.

sen.j: 明治維新後に本姓と名字が法的に一本化されて現在見られる姓のあり方に統合されていくまで、木下家は本姓を変えることがなかった。
sen.e: The Kinoshita family did not change its honsei (authentic surname) until after the Meiji Restoration, when honsei (authentic surname) and myoji (family name) were unified by law into an integrated form of surname that indicates family lineage as we can see today.

The Kinoshita family did not change its honsei (original name) until after the Meiji Restoration, when honsei (original name) and myoji (family name) were legally integrated into one, as the form which is seen today.
sen.cmt: authentic surname→original name と修正しました。文半ばより文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: The Kinoshita family did not change its honsei (original name) until after the Meiji Restoration, when honsei (original name) and myoji (family name) were legally integrated into one, as the form which is seen today.

sen.j: 日本史関係の書籍やテレビ番組などでは「大坂夏の陣で豊臣氏は滅亡した」と説明されることが多い。
sen.e: In books and TV programs related to Japanese history, it is often explained that 'the Toyotomi clan became downfallen in Osaka Natsu no Jin (Summer Siege of Osaka no Eki).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In books and TV programs related to Japanese history, it is often explained that 'the Toyotomi clan became downfallen in Osaka Natsu no Jin (Summer Siege of Osaka no Eki).
In books and TV programs related to Japanese history, it is often explained that 'the Toyotomi clan became downfallen in Osaka Natsu no Jin (Summer Siege of Osaka no Eki).

sen.j: が、これは大坂城主の豊臣宗家のみを指して「豊臣家」と呼ぶことが一般的であるためであり、豊臣氏全体が滅亡したという誤解を生じさせかねない不正確な表現である。
sen.e: This explanation is commonly accepted, because in general 'Toyotomi family' is exclusively understood as the head family of TOYOTOMI, the lord of Osaka-jo Castle, however, this is an inaccurate explanation that might lead to a misunderstanding that the whole Toyotomi clan was destructed there.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: However, this is because in general 'Toyotomi family' only refers to the head family of Toyotomi, the lord of Osaka-jo Castle, and, this is an inaccurate explanation that might lead to a misunderstanding that the whole Toyotomi clan was destroyed there.
sen.cmt: 文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: However, this is because in general 'Toyotomi family' only refers to the head family of Toyotomi, the lord of Osaka-jo Castle, and, this is an inaccurate explanation that might lead to a misunderstanding that the whole Toyotomi clan was destroyed there.

sen.j: 前述のように、実際には外戚の豊臣氏族（高台院側の血筋である木下家）が健在であったので、豊臣氏自体は江戸時代を通じて大名として存続している。
sen.e: As mentioned above, the Toyotomi clan of the maternal relative lineage (the Kinoshita family line of the Kodai-in side) was not destroyed and the Toyotomi clan itself, therefore, survived all through the Edo Period as a daimyo.
sen.cmt: 外戚の豊臣氏族→Toyotomi clan of the maternal relative lineage としました。
sen.e: As mentioned above, the Toyotomi clan of the maternal relative lineage (the Kinoshita family line of the Kodaiin side) was not destroyed and the Toyotomi clan itself, therefore, continued through the Edo period as a daimyo.
sen.cmt: ハイフンを削除しました。survived all→continued,Period→period と修正しました。
sen.e: As mentioned above, the Toyotomi clan of the maternal relative lineage (the Kinoshita family line of the Kodaiin side) was not destroyed and the Toyotomi clan itself, therefore, continued through the Edo period as a daimyo.

sen.j: また豊臣宗家の高台院自身も晩年に養子をとり、甥を「羽柴利次」と名乗らせ社稷を継承する者とした。
sen.e: Kodai-in of the head family of TOYOTOMI adopted her nephew's son and made him call himself 'Toshitsugu HASHIBA,' appointing him as the successor to shashoku (the reign) of the family.
sen.cmt: 社稷→定訳不明：shashoku (the reign) of the family としました。
sen.e: Kodaiin of the head family of TOYOTOMI adopted her nephew's son and made him call himself 'Toshitsugu HASHIBA,' appointing him as the successor to shashoku (the reign) of the family.
sen.cmt: ハイフンを削除しました。
sen.e: Kodaiin of the head family of TOYOTOMI adopted her nephew's son and made him call himself 'Toshitsugu HASHIBA,' appointing him as the successor to shashoku (the reign) of the family.

sen.j: 高台院没後は幕府から「羽柴」を称することを禁じられたため、木下利次と改名して高台院の遺領を継承し旗本として存続した。
sen.e: After Kodai-in's death, the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) prohibited him the use of 'Hashiba' as his family name, and, therefore, he changed his name to Toshitsugu KINOSHITA and survived as hatamoto (a direct retainer of the Shogun), taking up the posthumous estate of Kodai-in.

After Kodaiin's death, the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) forbade him to use the 'Hashiba' as his family name, and, therefore, he changed his name to Toshitsugu KINOSHITA and survived as hatamoto (a direct retainer of the Shogun), succeeding the posthumous estate of Kodaiin.
sen.cmt: ハイフンを削除しました。prohibited→forbade,the use of→to use the,taking up→succeeding と修正しました。
sen.e: After Kodaiin's death, the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) forbade him to use the 'Hashiba' as his family name, and, therefore, he changed his name to Toshitsugu KINOSHITA and survived as hatamoto (a direct retainer of the Shogun), succeeding the posthumous estate of Kodaiin.

tit.j: 氏族としての豊臣氏の歴史
tit.e: History of Toyotomi as a shizoku (clan).
History of the Toyotomi as a shizoku (clan)
tit.cmt: the を補いました。ピリオドを削除しました。
tit.e: History of the Toyotomi as a shizoku (clan)

sen.j: 氏族としての豊臣氏は、羽柴秀吉の兄弟姉妹および彼らの子孫たちからなる一族であるといえる。
sen.e: It can be said that the Toyotomi clan was formed by Hideyoshi HASHIBA's brothers and sisters as well as their descendents.
It can be said that the Toyotomi clan was formed by Hideyoshi HASHIBA's brothers and sisters as well as their descendents.
It can be said that the Toyotomi clan was formed by Hideyoshi HASHIBA's brothers and sisters as well as their descendents.

sen.j: 秀吉は乏しい親族を取り立て、弟秀長を大和国郡山100万石、甥秀次を近江国八幡43万石にとそれぞれ取り立てた。
sen.e: Hideyoshi gave special treatment to his relatives although they were scares in number, and he granted a territory of a stipend of 1million-koku crop yield in Koriyama of Yamato Province to his smaller brother Hidenaga, and a territory of a stipend of 430,000-koku crop yield in Yawata of Omi Province to his nephew Hidetsugu.

Hideyoshi promoted his limited relatives, and granted a territory of a stipend of 1million koku crop yield in Koriyama of Yamato Province to his younger brother Hidenaga, and a territory of a stipend of 430,000 koku crop yield in Yawata of Omi Province to his nephew Hidetsugu.
sen.cmt: 「乏しい親族を取り立て」の部分を修正しました。he granted→granted,-koku→koku,smaller brother→younger brother と修正しました。
sen.e: Hideyoshi promoted his limited relatives, and granted a territory of a stipend of 1million koku crop yield in Koriyama of Yamato Province to his younger brother Hidenaga, and a territory of a stipend of 430,000 koku crop yield in Yawata of Omi Province to his nephew Hidetsugu.

sen.j: 1589年には実子鶴松が生まれ、後継者と定めていたが、1590年に天下統一を果たした直後の1591年には秀長と鶴松が相次いで死亡する。
sen.e: In 1589, his biological child Tsurumatsu was born, and Hideyoshi appointed this be as his heir, however, soon after Hideyoshi achieved the unification of the whole country in 1590, Hidenaga (his brother) and Tsurumatsu (his son) died successively in 1591.

In 1589, his biological child Tsurumatsu was born, and Hideyoshi had decided Tsurumatsu to be his successor, however, soon after Hideyoshi achieved the unification of the whole country in 1590, Hidenaga and Tsurumatsu died successively in 1591.
sen.cmt: appointed→had decided, this be as his heir→Tsurumatsu to be his successor と修正しました。カッコ部分を削除しました。
sen.e: In 1589, his biological child Tsurumatsu was born, and Hideyoshi had decided Tsurumatsu to be his successor, however, soon after Hideyoshi achieved the unification of the whole country in 1590, Hidenaga and Tsurumatsu died successively in 1591.

sen.j: 落胆した秀吉は甥秀次を後継者と定め、1591年に関白職を譲る。
sen.e: Downhearted Hideyoshi decided his nephew Hidetsugu as his successor, and he passed over the position of Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor) in 1591.
Downhearted Hideyoshi decided his nephew Hidetsugu as his successor, and he passed over the position of Kanpaku (chief adviser to the emperor) in 1591.
Downhearted Hideyoshi decided his nephew Hidetsugu as his successor, and he passed over the position of Kanpaku (chief adviser to the emperor) in 1591.

sen.j: しかし、秀吉は全権を譲らず、太閤（※本来、太閤とは子弟に関白を譲った人物を指す）と呼ばれつつ豊臣宗家直轄領と軍権を掌握しつづけたので、次第に二重政権の矛盾が表面化してきた。
sen.e: However, Hideyoshi did not cede all of his authorities, and although he became to be called Taiko (father of the Imperial adviser) (*Taiko's original meaning was a person who passed over his position of Kanpaku to his successor), he continued gripping the direct control territory of the head family of TOYOTOMI and the military power, and in due course, contradictions derived from this dualism of power came up to the surface.

However, Hideyoshi did not hand over all of his authorities, and he continued to rule the direct control territory of the head family of Toyotomi and the military power although he became to be called Taiko (father of the Imperial adviser) (*Taiko refers to the person who passed over his position of Kanpaku to his successor), and consequently, the contradictions derived from this dualism of power came up to the surface.
sen.cmt: cede→hand over,オーダーを変更して修正しました。gripping→to rule,TOYOTOMI→Toyotomi,Taiko's original meaning was→Taiko refers to,a→the,in due course→consequently と修正しました。the を補いました。
sen.e: However, Hideyoshi did not hand over all of his authorities, and he continued to rule the direct control territory of the head family of Toyotomi and the military power although he became to be called Taiko (father of the Imperial adviser) (*Taiko refers to the person who passed over his position of Kanpaku to his successor), and consequently, the contradictions derived from this dualism of power came up to the surface.

sen.j: しかも1593年に秀吉に再び実子秀頼が生まれ、秀吉と秀次の対立は決定的に悪化してしまった。
sen.e: Moreover, in 1593 another biological son, Hideyori, was born to Hideyoshi, and the conflict between Hideyoshi and Hidetsugu became definitely serious.
Moreover, in 1593 another biological son, Hideyori, was born to Hideyoshi, and the conflict between Hideyoshi and Hidetsugu became definitely serious.
Moreover, in 1593 another biological son, Hideyori, was born to Hideyoshi, and the conflict between Hideyoshi and Hidetsugu became definitely serious.

sen.j: 1595年、秀吉は秀次を高野山に追放し、切腹させる。
sen.e: In 1595, Hideyoshi expelled Hidetsugu to Mt. Koya, and obliged him to commit seppuku (suicide by disembowelment).
In 1595, Hideyoshi expelled Hidetsugu to Mt. Koya, and obliged him to commit seppuku (suicide by disembowelment).
In 1595, Hideyoshi expelled Hidetsugu to Mt. Koya, and obliged him to commit seppuku (suicide by disembowelment).

sen.j: これによって二重政権は解消され、豊臣政権は再び秀吉のもとに一元化されるが、政権の正統性の拠り所である関白職は豊臣宗家から失われた。
sen.e: By Hidetsugu's death, the dual power system was dissolved and the Toyotomi administration was unified again under Hideyoshi, however, the head family of TOYOTOMI lost the post of Kanpaku, which was the only cause to justify the Toyotomi's administration.

By Hidetsugu's death, the dual government was dissolved and the Toyotomi administration was unified again under Hideyoshi, however, the head family of TOYOTOMI lost the post of Kanpaku, by which the government could justify itself.
sen.cmt: power system→government,「政権の正統性の拠り所である関白職は豊臣宗家から失われた」の部分を修正しました。
sen.e: By Hidetsugu's death, the dual government was dissolved and the Toyotomi administration was unified again under Hideyoshi, however, the head family of TOYOTOMI lost the post of Kanpaku, by which the government could justify itself.

sen.j: また、秀長を継いだ秀保もこの頃死に、豊臣宗家を支える血族の藩屏は存在しなくなった。
sen.e: In addition, Hidenaga's heir, Hideyasu, also died around that period, and the blood relatives that could be a guarding wall to support the head family of TOYOTOMI had disappeared.
In addition, Hideyasu, who succeeded Hidenaga also died around that time, and the blood relatives that could be a guarding wall to support the head family of Toyotomi disappeared.
sen.cmt: Hidenaga's heir, Hideyasu→Hideyasu, who succeeded Hidenaga,period→time,TOYOTOMI had→Toyotomi と修正しました。
sen.e: In addition, Hideyasu, who succeeded Hidenaga also died around that time, and the blood relatives that could be a guarding wall to support the head family of Toyotomi disappeared.

sen.j: 1598年に秀吉が死ぬと、後事を託された有力大名の中から徳川家康が台頭し、1600年の関ヶ原の戦いで石田三成ら豊臣政権擁護派の諸大名を倒し、覇権を打ちたてる。
sen.e: After Hideyoshi died in 1598, Ieyasu TOKUGAWA began to emerge out of the powerful daimyos who were consigned by Hideyoshi to take care of the posthumous affaires, and in the Battle of Sekigahara in 1600, Ieyasu defeated the daimyos who were in support of the Toyotomi administration, such as Mitsunari ISHIDA, and achieved to dominate the country.
sen.cmt: 血族の藩屏→定訳不明：blood relatives that could be a guarding wall としました。
sen.e: After Hideyoshi died in 1598, Ieyasu TOKUGAWA began to emerge out of the powerful daimyo who were consigned by Hideyoshi to take care of the posthumous affaires, and in the Battle of Sekigahara in 1600, Ieyasu defeated the daimyo who were in support of the Toyotomi administration, including Mitsunari ISHIDA, and achieved to dominate the country.
sen.cmt: daimyos→daimyo,such as→including と修正しました。
sen.e: After Hideyoshi died in 1598, Ieyasu TOKUGAWA began to emerge out of the powerful daimyo who were consigned by Hideyoshi to take care of the posthumous affaires, and in the Battle of Sekigahara in 1600, Ieyasu defeated the daimyo who were in support of the Toyotomi administration, including Mitsunari ISHIDA, and achieved to dominate the country.

sen.j: 1603年に家康は征夷大将軍に就任して江戸幕府を開き、1605年には将軍職を子の徳川秀忠に譲って徳川政権の正統性を確立していき、豊臣宗家は全国政権の座から完全に滑り落ちてしまった。
sen.e: In 1603, he held the position of Seii taishogun (literally, 'great general who subdues the barbarians") and set up the Edo bakufu (feudal government headed by Ieyasu), and in 1605, he passed over the Shogunate to his son Hidetada TOKUGAWA in order to secure the justification of the Tokugawa Administration, and consequently, the head family of TOYOTOMI had completely lost its authority over the country.

In 1603, he became the seii taishogun (literally, 'great general who subdues the barbarians") and established the Edo bakufu (feudal government headed by Ieyasu), and in 1605, he passed over the shogunate to his son Hidetada TOKUGAWA in order to secure the legitimacy of the Tokugawa Administration, and consequently, the head family of Toyotomi completely lost its authority over the country.
sen.cmt: held the position of→became,Seii→seii, the を補いました。set up→established,Shogunate→shogunate,justification→legitimacy,（ここでの”正統性”は”血筋・嫡流”と理解しました）TOYOTOMI had→Toyotomi と修正しました。
sen.e: In 1603, he became the seii taishogun (literally, 'great general who subdues the barbarians") and established the Edo bakufu (feudal government headed by Ieyasu), and in 1605, he passed over the shogunate to his son Hidetada TOKUGAWA in order to secure the legitimacy of the Tokugawa Administration, and consequently, the head family of Toyotomi completely lost its authority over the country.

sen.j: しかし、徳川政権の確立していく様を見ても、豊臣秀頼は一大名として徳川将軍に臣従することを認めなかった。
sen.e: However, Hideyori TOYOTOMI, who was cast down to a daimyo, did not accept the submission to Tokugawa Shogunate as a mere retainer, even though witnessing the consolidation process of the Tokugawa Administration.

However, Hideyori TOYOTOMI, who was cast down to a daimyo, did not accept the submission to the Tokugawa Shogunate as a mere retainer, although witnessing the process of establishment of the Tokugawa Administration.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。 even though→although,consolidation process→process of establishment と修正しました。
sen.e: However, Hideyori TOYOTOMI, who was cast down to a daimyo, did not accept the submission to the Tokugawa Shogunate as a mere retainer, although witnessing the process of establishment of the Tokugawa Administration.

sen.j: これに後顧の憂いを感じた家康は、1614年に大坂の役を起こし、さらに翌年の大坂の役で大坂城を落とし、秀頼らを自害させる。
sen.e: Ieyasu, who saw Hideyori a possible threat in the future, arose Osaka no Eki (The Siege of Osaka) in 1614, and in the next year when Ieyasu surrendered Osaka-jo Castle in the second siege of Osaka no Eki, he brought Hideyoshi and others to kill themselves.
sen.cmt: 後顧の憂いを感じた→saw Hideyori a possible threat in the future としました。
sen.e: Ieyasu, who felt an anxiety about this, arose Osaka no Eki (The Siege of Osaka) in 1614, and in the following year when Ieyasu surrendered Osaka-jo Castle in the second siege of Osaka no Eki, he brought Hideyoshi and others to kill themselves.
sen.cmt: 「これに後顧の憂いを感じた」の部分を修正しました。next year→following year と修正しました。
sen.e: Ieyasu, who felt an anxiety about this, arose Osaka no Eki (The Siege of Osaka) in 1614, and in the following year when Ieyasu surrendered Osaka-jo Castle in the second siege of Osaka no Eki, he brought Hideyoshi and others to kill themselves.

sen.j: 秀頼の遺児・国松は、同じ慶長20年5月23日（グレゴリオ暦1615年6月19日）に京の三条河原にて処刑され、ここに秀吉の興した豊臣宗家は断絶した。
sen.e: Hideyori's posthumous child, Kunimatsu, was executed on June 19, 1615 at Sanjo-gawara Riverside in Kyoto, and hereto, the head family of TOYOTOMI, which Hideyoshi founded, was discontinued.
Hideyori's posthumous child, Kunimatsu, was executed on June 19, 1615 at Sanjo-gawara Riverside in Kyoto, and hereto, the head family of TOYOTOMI, which Hideyoshi founded, died out.
sen.cmt: was discontinued→died out と修正しました。
sen.e: Hideyori's posthumous child, Kunimatsu, was executed on June 19, 1615 at Sanjo-gawara Riverside in Kyoto, and hereto, the head family of TOYOTOMI, which Hideyoshi founded, died out.

sen.j: なお、国松は薩摩国に逃れて島津氏にかくまわれ、豊後国日出藩木下家の分家である交代寄合木下家の祖・木下延次になったという異説がある。
sen.e: There is a theory, in which Kunimatsu who escaped to Satsuma Province, was harbored by the Shimazu clan, and afterwards, he changed his name to Nobutsugu KINOSHITA and became the ancestor of the Kinoshita family, a family of Kotaiyoriai (a status of samurai warriors in the Edo Period which was in charge of a rotating member of the top decision-making organ) as well as a branch family of the Hinode Domain in Bungo Province.
sen.cmt: 交代寄合→定訳不明：Kotaiyoriai (a status of samurai warriors in the Edo Period which was in charge of a rotating member of the top decision-making organ) としました。
sen.e: In addition, there is a theory in which, Kunimatsu who escaped to Satsuma Province, was sheltered by the Shimazu clan, then became Nobutsugu KINOSHITA, the ancestor of the Kinoshita family and a family of Kotaiyoriai (a status of samurai warriors in the Edo period which was in charge of a rotating member of the top decision-making organ) as well as a branch family of the Hinode Domain in Bungo Province.
sen.cmt: In addition, を補いました。 harbored→sheltered,and afterwards, he changed his name to→then became と修正しました。and became→カンマ、カンマ→and,Period→period と修正しました。
sen.e: In addition, there is a theory in which, Kunimatsu who escaped to Satsuma Province, was sheltered by the Shimazu clan, then became Nobutsugu KINOSHITA, the ancestor of the Kinoshita family and a family of Kotaiyoriai (a status of samurai warriors in the Edo period which was in charge of a rotating member of the top decision-making organ) as well as a branch family of the Hinode Domain in Bungo Province.

sen.j: その子孫は現在、先祖の豊臣姓を苗字に名乗っているという。
sen.e: It is said that even today his descendents still use their ancestor's authentic surname 'Toyotomi' as their family name.
sen.cmt: 苗字→family name としました。
sen.e: It is said that the descendents of the Toyotomi today still use their ancestor's name as their family names.
sen.cmt: even を削除しました。よりスムースに修正しました。
sen.e: It is said that the descendents of the Toyotomi today still use their ancestor's name as their family names.

sen.j: しかし、幕府に認められた正式な豊臣氏の継承者は、高台院が晩年にむかえた養子の羽柴利次（実父は小早川秀秋の兄・木下利房）とされている。
sen.e: However, the Toyotomi clan's official successor admitted by the bakufu was Toshitsugu HASHIBA, the adoptive son that Kodai-in took in her late life (Toshitsugu's real father was said to be Toshifusa KINOSHITA, Hideaki KOBAYAKAWA's older brother).

However, the Toyotomi clan's official successor approved by the bakufu was Toshitsugu HASHIBA, the adoptive son that Kodai-in took in her late life (Toshitsugu's real father was said to be Toshifusa KINOSHITA, Hideaki KOBAYAKAWA's older brother).

However, the Toyotomi clan's official successor approved by the bakufu was Toshitsugu HASHIBA, the adoptive son that Kodai-in took in her late life (Toshitsugu's real father was said to be Toshifusa KINOSHITA, Hideaki KOBAYAKAWA's older brother).

tit.j: 氏族としての豊臣氏の人々
tit.e: People of the Toyotomi clan: by family
People of the Toyotomi as a clan
tit.cmt: よりスムースに修正しました。

sen.e: Kodai-in (Sadatoshi SUGIHARA's daughter, Hideyoshi's lawful wife)
Kodaiin (Sadatoshi SUGIHARA's daughter, Hideyoshi's lawful wife)

Kita no Mandokoro (legal wife of regent or chief adviser to the Emperor).

sen.j: 公式な名は豊臣吉子）

Formal name was Yoshiko TOYOTOMI)
Formal name was Yoshiko TOYOTOMI)

Hidekatsu HASHIBA (Ishimatsumaru) (premature death)
Hidekatsu HASHIBA (Ishimatsumaru) (premature death)

sen.j: 豊臣鶴松（夭折、秀吉の側室淀殿の子）
sen.e: Tsurumatsu TOYOTOMI (premature death, Hideyoshi's concubine, Yodo-dono [Madam Yodo]'s son)
Tsurumatsu TOYOTOMI (premature death, Hideyoshi's concubine, Yodo-dono son)
Tsurumatsu TOYOTOMI (premature death, Hideyoshi's concubine, Yodo-dono son)

sen.e: Hideyori TOYOTOMI (Hideyoshi's concubine, Yodo-dono's son)
Hideyori TOYOTOMI (Hideyoshi's concubine, Yodo-dono's son)
Hideyori TOYOTOMI (Hideyoshi's concubine, Yodo-dono's son)

sen.j: 豊臣国松（秀頼の子、斬首刑死）
sen.e: Kunimatsu TOYOTOMI (Hideyori's son, death by decapitation)
Kunimatsu TOYOTOMI (Hideyori's son, death by decapitation)

sen.e: Hidekatsu HASHIBA (Hideyoshi's adopted son, Nobunaga ODA's son)
Hidekatsu HASHIBA (Hideyoshi's adopted son, Nobunaga ODA's son)
Hidekatsu HASHIBA (Hideyoshi's adopted son, Nobunaga ODA's son)

sen.j: 豊臣秀勝（秀吉の養子、姉日秀の子で三好吉房の次男）
sen.e: HidekatsuTOYOTOMI (Hideyoshi's adopted son, the son of his older sister, Nisshu, and the second son of Yoshifusa MIYOSHI)
HidekatsuTOYOTOMI (Hideyoshi's adopted son, the son of his older sister, Nisshu, and the second son of Yoshifusa MIYOSHI)

sen.e: Sadako TOYOTOMI (the daughter of Nisshu's son, Katsuhide TOYOTOMI, and Yukiie KUJO's wife)

sen.j: （秀吉の母。木下弥右衛門室、竹阿弥室。公式な名は豊臣仲子）
sen.e: (Hideyoshi's mother, Yaemon KINOSHITA's wife, Chikuami's wife, her official name was Nakako TOYOTOMI)
sen.cmt: （秀吉の母。を上列から移動しました。 公式な名は豊臣仲子）を下列から移動しました。
sen.e: (Hideyoshi's mother, Yaemon KINOSHITA's wife, Chikuami's wife, her official name was Nakako TOYOTOMI)
